column4: My gnome desktop is missing the menu bars at the top and bottom when I started my computer today. Last night I deleted quite a lot from the computer so I deleted something I shouldn't. Is there an easy way to reinstate??
Is there any way I can divide my computer to keep all files etc., separate from programs?
install your home folder on a separate partition
does this mean I have to reinstall the programs to do that
nope.. you can move it without reinstalling.. but it takes a little work and some planning
not really.. but you'll have to use it to create a new partition
I think I need to reinstall the Ubuntu CD again to reprogram as I am having problem with gnome. How would I start separating beforehand so I dont lose the folders
just create a partition and copy your home folder to it
nb!, copy!.. not move
you make it sound so easy. How do I start partitioning?
partitioning is done using gparted.. or system, administration, partition editor
so if I go to terminal (which I can still do without my menu bars) what do I type in?

you need to create a partition that's big enough for your files.. copy everything to it.. I'm not really sure how to keep the installer from killing it but there ought to be a way.. please do a backup first though
I cant get into sysem, administration etc., as I have no menu bars
to start the partition editor? gksudo gparted
if that doesn't work you have to install it first.. sudo apt-get install gparted
could I just try terminal and type in gksudo gparted
sure.
will it then show me thru what to do
once I have created a new partition what do I do
you create a partition, format it (use ext3), then copy the files from your home to that new partition
can I send you a private message plse?
sure
